intro: Schaefferia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf schaefferia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late summer, adding ornamental value to gardens. Schaefferia stenophylla is prized for its resilience and low maintenance requirements, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
